sentences.english: The regional crisis makes people tortured by heart blank and disorientation, and so on.
sentences.chinese: 出现信仰危机，人们普遍心灵空虚，迷失方向等等。

sentences.english: Otherwise, you will easily get lost or hesitate to go ahead.
sentences.chinese: 否则，你很容易就会迷失方向或者犹豫不前。

sentences.english: The winding trail caused us to lose our orientation.
sentences.chinese: 迂回曲折的小道使我们迷失了方向。

sentences.english: In the long run of history, the censorship and the inquisitor have always lost.
sentences.chinese: 在历史的长河中，审查制度和审查官总是迷失了方向。

sentences.english: TASTING NOTES : Aromas of thyme, rosemary and other herbs typical of the "garrigue"(Mediterranean scrubland) can be detected in the bouquet.
sentences.chinese: 气味带有百里香，迷失香和地中海灌木丛香气。

sentences.english: Nothing about him gave any suggestion of a child lost in the middle of the desert, a thousand miles from any human habitation.
sentences.chinese: 他丝毫不象是一个迷失在旷无人烟的大沙漠中的孩子。

sentences.english: I often lose myself in thought late at night!
sentences.chinese: 我经常三更半夜陷入沉思，迷失自我。

sentences.english: We were like the geese, blind, lost, perishing.
sentences.chinese: 我们就像大雁一样，盲目，迷失，麻木。

sentences.english: Maybe that being lost in a good book doesn't mean you're zoned out.
sentences.chinese: 也许迷失在一个好的故事中不意味着你被圈住了。

sentences.english: But if you succeed in not being like them, you lose.
sentences.chinese: 一旦你成功的做不像他们那样的人，你就迷失了。

sentences.english: We were quite disorientated by the maze of streets.
sentences.chinese: 街道曲曲弯弯的，把我们弄得迷失了方向。
我们大家有时会迷失方向，不知道自己在那。

sentences.english: But go ye rather to the lost sheep of the house of Israel.
sentences.chinese: 你们宁可往以色列家迷失了的羊那里去。

sentences.english: They were lost and stranded by this storm.
sentences.chinese: 它们因大雪迷失了方向而在此徘徊。

sentences.english: I missed the turnoff and went 15 miles out of mey way.
sentences.chinese: 我迷失在岔道中，向前走了15英里就完全迷路了。

definition: to sink into (vice, depravity etc)/to pass into oblivion/downfall/passing
to indulge in/to wallow/absorbed in/deeply engrossed/addicted
to pace back and forth/to hesitate/to be indecisive
to wander/to roam about/to loaf about/to be idle
deeply immersed/fig. wallowing in/deeply engrossed in
to be engrossed/to be absorbed with/to lose oneself in/to be addicted to
